definition: bottomless pit
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I am really looking to jump off a bottomless pit, never getout.
sentences.chinese: 我真想找一個無底洞跳下去，永遠出不來。

sentences.english: At night they stayed in a temple. The evil spirit took Tang Priest to her Bottomless Cave using an evil wind.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚，耗子精用妖風把唐僧擒到住處無底洞。

sentences.english: Julia said and she jumped down into the dark pit.
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亞說完就跳進了那個無底洞。

sentences.english: The king kicked the foreign herald into a bottomless pit.
sentences.chinese: 國王把國外的使者一腳踢到無底洞裏去。

sentences.english: To this fallen star was given the key of the bottomless pit.
sentences.chinese: 這一下降是由於恆星的關鍵的無底洞。
托鉢人的荷包是無底洞。

sentences.english: Decken's sifaka peers out from a jagged stone maw.
sentences.chinese: 一隻德肯狐猴從一處鋸齒狀的石頭無底洞窺視。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to work to no avail (idiom)
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to harbor evil designs/to harbor malicious intentions
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
to force someone to do something
